page.title: 17OAKAMOOR'S INDUSTRIAL PAST
page.content: The lime-kilns, and the brick terraced houses in the village and trailing along River-side, reflect Oakamoor's industrial past.Much of the village was built by Thomas Bolton and Sons for the workers at the Copper and Brass Works which dominated the site now landscaped as a picnic area.The river provided the power for waterwheels which drove the machinery to make copper wire and pipes and had brought other works to Oakamoor before the Boltons came in 1852. Signs of past industrial activity can be seen on the Picnic Area.The first trans- Atlantic cable was made at the Oakamoor works and successfully laid in 1866. Boltons built the chapel and a school and provided the Sports Ground. It was from the works that the village obtained the power to become the first to have electric street lighting. Boltons left Oakamoor in 1963.
